docs.text: If you want to use HTTPS. You need a SSL cert. The 2 ways i'm going to show are free. Letsencrypt Cert Cloudflare Cert The downsides. If you use letsencrypt. You need to renew the SSL record every 3 months. Cloudflare you dont. The one problem is you need to change your domain nameservers to cloudflare. The upsides. Letsencrypt you can set up with 3 or more commands. If you use CloudFlare you need to change your nameservers to cloudflare. But you get 5 year certificates. And after 5 years you can renew them.

docs.text: How to get letsencrypt cert. Letsencrypt with Nginx Letsencrypt with Apache Letsencrypt with Standalone Install Certbot sudo apt update sudo apt install -y certbot sudo apt install -y python3-certbot-nginx Make the Cert certbot certonly --nginx -d domain.com Install Certbot sudo apt update sudo apt install -y certbot sudo apt install -y python3-certbot-apache Make the Cert certbot certonly --apache -d domain.com Install Certbot sudo apt update sudo apt install -y certbot Make the Cert certbot certonly --standalone -d domain.com

docs.text: This is the wordpress template. Letsencrypt SSL Cloudflare SSL Wordpress with Letsencrypt Wordpress with Cloudflare SSL server { listen 80; server_name www.domain.com domain.com; return 301 https://www.domain.com$request_uri; } server { listen 443; listen [::]:433; ssl_certificate /etc/letsencrypt/live/www.domain.com/fullchain.pem ; ssl_certificate_key /etc/letsencrypt/live/www.domain.com/privkey.pem ; root /var/www/wordpress; index index.php index.html index.htm; server_name www.domain.com; error_log /var/log/nginx/mysite.com_error.log; access_log /var/log/nginx/mysite.com_access.log; client_max_body_size 100M; location / { try_files $uri $uri/ /index.php?$args; } location ~ \.php$ { include snippets/fastcgi-php.conf; fastcgi_pass unix:/run/php/php7.4-fpm.sock; fastcgi_param SCRIPT_FILENAME $document_root$fastcgi_script_name; } } server { listen 80; server_name www.domain.com domain.com; return 301 https://www.domain.com$request_uri; } server { listen 443; listen [::]:433; ssl_certificate /etc/ssl/cert.pem ; ssl_certificate_key /etc/ssl/key.pem; root /var/www/wordpress; index index.php index.html index.htm; server_name www.domain.com; error_log /var/log/nginx/mysite.com_error.log; access_log /var/log/nginx/mysite.com_access.log; client_max_body_size 100M; location / { try_files $uri $uri/ /index.php?$args; } location ~ \.php$ { include snippets/fastcgi-php.conf; fastcgi_pass unix:/run/php/php7.4-fpm.sock; fastcgi_param SCRIPT_FILENAME $document_root$fastcgi_script_name; } }
